<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="provision-and-coordination-of-care">Provision and Coordination of Care<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#provision-and-coordination-of-care" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>Relates to the coordination, organisation and provision of nursing care that includes the assessment of individuals/groups, planning, implementation and evaluation of care.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="5-conducts-a-comprehensive-and-systematic-nursing-assessment">5. Conducts a comprehensive and systematic nursing assessment<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#5-conducts-a-comprehensive-and-systematic-nursing-assessment" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h4 level="4" id="5-1-uses-a-relevant-evidence-based-assessment-framework-to-collect-data-about-the-physical-socio-cultural-and-mental-health-of-the-individual-group">5.1 Uses a relevant evidence-based assessment framework to collect data about the physical socio-cultural and mental health of the individual/group<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#5-1-uses-a-relevant-evidence-based-assessment-framework-to-collect-data-about-the-physical-socio-cultural-and-mental-health-of-the-individual-group" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h4></div>
<ul>
<li>approaches and organises assessment in a structured way</li>
<li>uses all available evidence sources, including individuals/groups/significant others, health care team, records, reports, and own knowledge and experience</li>
<li>collects data that relates to physiological, psychological, spiritual, socio-economic and cultural variables on an ongoing basis</li>
<li>understands the role of research-based, and other forms of evidence</li>
<li>confirms data with the individual/group and members of the health care team</li>
<li>uses appropriate assessment tools and strategies to assist the collection of data</li>
<li>frames questions in ways that indicate the use of a theoretical framework/structured approach</li>
<li>ensures practice is sensitive and supportive to cultural issues</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h4 level="4" id="5-2-uses-a-range-of-assessment-techniques-to-collect-relevant-and-accurate-data">5.2 Uses a range of assessment techniques to collect relevant and accurate data<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#5-2-uses-a-range-of-assessment-techniques-to-collect-relevant-and-accurate-data" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h4></div>
<ul>
<li>uses a range of data gathering techniques, including observation, interview, physical examination and measurement in obtaining a nursing history and assessment</li>
<li>collaboratively identifies actual and potential health problems through accurate interpretation of data</li>
<li>accurately uses health care technologies in accordance with manufacturer's specification and organisational policy</li>
<li>identifies deviations from normal, or improvements in the individual's/group's, health status</li>
<li>identifies and incorporates the needs and preferences of individuals/group into a plan of care</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h4 level="4" id="5-3-analyses-and-interprets-assessment-data-accurately">5.3 Analyses and interprets assessment data accurately<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#5-3-analyses-and-interprets-assessment-data-accurately" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h4></div>
<ul>
<li>recognises that clinical judgements involve consideration of conflicting information and evidence</li>
<li>identifies types and sources of supplementary information for nursing assessment</li>
<li>describes the role of supplementary information in nursing assessment</li>
<li>demonstrates knowledge of quantitative and qualitative data to assess individual/group needs</li>
</ul>
<p>NATIONAL COMPETENCIES FOR THE REGISTERED NURSEâ€”AUSTRALIA
317</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="national-competency-standards-for-the-registered-nurse-continued">National Competency Standards for the Registered Nurse (continued)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#national-competency-standards-for-the-registered-nurse-continued" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="6-plans-nursing-care-in-consultation-with-individuals-groups-significant-others-and-the-interdisciplinary-health-care-team">6. Plans nursing care in consultation with individuals/groups, significant others and the interdisciplinary health care team<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#6-plans-nursing-care-in-consultation-with-individuals-groups-significant-others-and-the-interdisciplinary-health-care-team" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="6-1-determines-agreed-priorities-for-resolving-health-needs-of-individuals-groups">6.1 Determines agreed priorities for resolving health needs of individuals/groups<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#6-1-determines-agreed-priorities-for-resolving-health-needs-of-individuals-groups" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>incorporates relevant assessment data in developing a plan for care</li>
<li>determines priorities for care, based on nursing assessment of an individual's/group's needs for intervention, current nursing knowledge and research</li>
<li>considers individual/group preferences when determining priorities for careactively in performance review processes</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="6-2-identifies-expected-and-agreed-individual-group-health-outcomes-including-a-time-frame-for-achievement">6.2 Identifies expected and agreed individual/group health outcomes including a time frame for achievement<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#6-2-identifies-expected-and-agreed-individual-group-health-outcomes-including-a-time-frame-for-achievement" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>establishes realistic short- and long-term goals that identify individual/group health outcomes and specify condition for achievement</li>
<li>identifies goals that are measurable, achievable, and congruent with values and beliefs of the individual/group and/or significant others</li>
<li>uses resources to support the achievement of outcomes</li>
<li>identifies criteria for evaluation of expected outcomes</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="6-3-documents-a-plan-of-care-to-achieve-expected-outcomes">6.3 Documents a plan of care to achieve expected outcomes<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#6-3-documents-a-plan-of-care-to-achieve-expected-outcomes" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>ensures that plans of care are based on an ongoing analysis of assessment data</li>
<li>plans care that is consistent with current nursing knowledge and research</li>
<li>documents plans of care clearly</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="6-4-plans-for-continuity-of-care-to-achieve-expected-outcomes">6.4 Plans for continuity of care to achieve expected outcomes<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#6-4-plans-for-continuity-of-care-to-achieve-expected-outcomes" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>collaboratively supports the therapeutic interventions of other health team members</li>
<li>information necessary for continuity of the plan of care is maintained and documented</li>
<li>responds to individual/group or carer's educational needs</li>
<li>provides or facilitates an individual/group or carer's resources and aids as required</li>
<li>identifies and recommends appropriate agency, government and community resources to ensure continuity of care</li>
<li>initiates necessary contacts and referrals to external agencies</li>
<li>forwards all information needed for continuity of care when an individual/group is transferred to another facility or discharged</li>
</ul>
<p>FUNDAMENTALS OF NURSING: CLINICAL SKILLS WORKBOOK</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="national-competency-standards-for-the-registered-nurse-continued">National Competency Standards for the Registered Nurse (continued)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#national-competency-standards-for-the-registered-nurse-continued" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="7-provides-comprehensive-safe-and-effective-evidence-based-nursing-care-to-achieve-identified-individual-group-health-outcomes">7. Provides comprehensive, safe and effective evidence-based nursing care to achieve identified individual/group health outcomes<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-provides-comprehensive-safe-and-effective-evidence-based-nursing-care-to-achieve-identified-individual-group-health-outcomes" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="7-1-effectively-manages-the-nursing-care-of-individuals-groups">7.1 Effectively manages the nursing care of individuals/ groups<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-1-effectively-manages-the-nursing-care-of-individuals-groups" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>uses resources effectively and efficiently in providing care</li>
<li>performs actions in a manner consistent with relevant nursing principles</li>
<li>performs procedures confidently and safely</li>
<li>monitors responses of individuals/groups throughout each intervention and adjusts care accordingly</li>
<li>provides education and support to assist development and maintenance of independent living skills</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="7-2-provides-nursing-care-according-to-the-documented-care-or-treatment-plan">7.2 Provides nursing care according to the documented care or treatment plan<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-2-provides-nursing-care-according-to-the-documented-care-or-treatment-plan" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>acts consistently with the predetermined plan of care</li>
<li>uses a range of appropriate strategies to facilitate the individual/group's achievement of short and long term expected goals</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="7-3-prioritises-workload-based-on-the-individual-s-group-s-needs-acuity-and-optimal-time-for-intervention">7.3 Prioritises workload based on the individual's/group's needs, acuity and optimal time for intervention<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-3-prioritises-workload-based-on-the-individual-s-group-s-needs-acuity-and-optimal-time-for-intervention" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>determines priorities for care, based on nursing assessment of an individual/group's needs for intervention, current nursing knowledge and research</li>
<li>considers the individual/group's preferences when determining priorities for care</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="7-4-responds-effectively-to-unexpected-or-rapidly-changing-situations">7.4 Responds effectively to unexpected or rapidly changing situations<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-4-responds-effectively-to-unexpected-or-rapidly-changing-situations" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>responds effectively to emergencies</li>
<li>maintains self-control in the clinical setting and under stress conditions</li>
<li>implements crisis interventions and emergency routines as necessary</li>
<li>maintains current knowledge of emergency plans and procedures to maximise effectiveness in crisis situations</li>
<li>participates in emergency management practices and drills according to agency policy</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="7-5-delegates-aspects-of-care-to-others-according-to-their-competence-and-scope-of-practice">7.5 Delegates aspects of care to others according to their competence and scope of practice<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-5-delegates-aspects-of-care-to-others-according-to-their-competence-and-scope-of-practice" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>delegates aspects of care according to role, functions, capabilities and learning needs</li>
<li>monitors aspects of care delegated to others and provides clarification/assistance as required</li>
<li>recognises own accountabilities and responsibilities when delegating aspects of care to others</li>
<li>delegates to and supervises others consistent with legislation and organisational policy</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="7-6-provides-effective-and-timely-direction-and-supervision-to-ensure-that-delegated-care-is-provided-safely-and-accurately">7.6 Provides effective and timely direction and supervision to ensure that delegated care is provided safely and accurately<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-6-provides-effective-and-timely-direction-and-supervision-to-ensure-that-delegated-care-is-provided-safely-and-accurately" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>supervises and evaluates nursing care provided by others</li>
<li>uses a range of direct and indirect techniques such as instructing, coaching, mentoring, and collaborating in the supervision and support of others</li>
<li>provides support with documentation to nurses being supervised or to whom care has been delegated</li>
<li>delegates activities consistent with scope of practice/competence</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="7-7-educates-individuals-groups-to-promote-independence-and-control-over-their-health">7.7 Educates individuals/groups to promote independence and control over their health<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-7-educates-individuals-groups-to-promote-independence-and-control-over-their-health" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>identifies and documents specific educational requirements and requests of individuals/groups</li>
<li>undertakes formal and informal education sessions with individuals/groups as necessary</li>
<li>identifies appropriate educational resources, including other health professionals</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="7-8-uses-health-care-resources-effectively-and-efficiently-to-promote-optimal-nursing-and-health-care">7.8 Uses health care resources effectively and efficiently to promote optimal nursing and health care<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-8-uses-health-care-resources-effectively-and-efficiently-to-promote-optimal-nursing-and-health-care" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>recognises when nursing resources are insufficient to meet an individual's/group's needs</li>
<li>demonstrates flexibility in providing care where resources are limited</li>
<li>recognises the responsibility to report to relevant persons when level of resources risks compromising the quality of care</li>
</ul>
<p>NATIONAL COMPETENCIES FOR THE REGISTERED NURSEâ€”AUSTRALIA 319</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="national-competency-standards-for-the-registered-nurse-continued">National Competency Standards for the Registered Nurse (continued)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#national-competency-standards-for-the-registered-nurse-continued" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="8-evaluates-progress-towards-expected-individual-group-health-outcomes-in-consultation-with-individuals-groups-significant-others-and-interdisciplinary-health-care-team">8. Evaluates progress towards expected individual/group health outcomes in consultation with individuals/groups, significant others and interdisciplinary health care team<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#8-evaluates-progress-towards-expected-individual-group-health-outcomes-in-consultation-with-individuals-groups-significant-others-and-interdisciplinary-health-care-team" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="8-1-determines-progress-of-individuals-groups-toward-planned-outcomes">8.1 Determines progress of individuals/groups toward planned outcomes<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#8-1-determines-progress-of-individuals-groups-toward-planned-outcomes" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>recognises when individual's/group's progress and expected progress differ and modifies plans and actions accordingly</li>
<li>discusses progress with the individual/group</li>
<li>evaluates individual/group responses to interventions</li>
<li>assesses the effectiveness of the plan of care in achieving planned outcomes</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="8-2-revises-the-plan-of-care-and-determines-further-outcomes-in-accordance-with-evaluation-data">8.2 Revises the plan of care and determines further outcomes in accordance with evaluation data<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#8-2-revises-the-plan-of-care-and-determines-further-outcomes-in-accordance-with-evaluation-data" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>revises expected outcomes, nursing interventions and priorities with any change in an individual's/group's condition, needs or situational variations</li>
<li>communicates new information and revisions to members of the health care team as required</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="collaborative-and-therapeutic-practice">Collaborative and Therapeutic Practice<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#collaborative-and-therapeutic-practice" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Relates to establishing, sustaining and concluding professional relationships with individuals/groups. This also contains those competencies that relate to the nurse understanding their contribution to the interdisciplinary health care team.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="9-establishes-maintains-and-appropriately-concludes-therapeutic-relationships">9. Establishes, maintains and appropriately concludes therapeutic relationships<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#9-establishes-maintains-and-appropriately-concludes-therapeutic-relationships" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="9-1-establishes-therapeutic-relationships-that-are-goal-directed-and-recognises-professional-boundaries">9.1 Establishes therapeutic relationships that are goal directed and recognises professional boundaries<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#9-1-establishes-therapeutic-relationships-that-are-goal-directed-and-recognises-professional-boundaries" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>demonstrates empathy, trust and respect for the dignity and potential of the individual/group</li>
<li>interacts with individuals/groups in a supportive manner</li>
<li>effectively initiates, maintains and concludes interpersonal interactions</li>
<li>establishes rapport with individuals/groups that enhances their ability to express feelings, and fosters an appropriate context for expression of feeling</li>
<li>understands the potential benefits of partnership approaches on nurse individual/group relationships</li>
<li>demonstrates an understanding of standards and practices of professional boundaries and therapeutic relationships</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="9-2-communicates-effectively-with-individuals-groups-to-facilitate-provision-of-care">9.2 Communicates effectively with individuals/groups to facilitate provision of care<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#9-2-communicates-effectively-with-individuals-groups-to-facilitate-provision-of-care" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>uses a range of effective communication techniques</li>
<li>uses language appropriate to the context</li>
<li>uses written and spoken communication skills appropriate to the needs of individuals/groups</li>
<li>uses an interpreter where appropriate</li>
<li>provides adequate time for discussion</li>
<li>establishes, where possible, alternative communication methods for individuals/groups who are unable to verbalise</li>
<li>uses open/closed questions appropriately</li>
</ul>
<p>FUNDAMENTALS OF NURSING: CLINICAL SKILLS WORKBOOK</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="national-competency-standards-for-the-registered-nurse-continued">National Competency Standards for the Registered Nurse (continued)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#national-competency-standards-for-the-registered-nurse-continued" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>9.3 Uses appropriate strategies to promote an individual's/ group's self-esteem, dignity, integrity and comfort</p>
<ul>
<li>identifies and uses strategies which encourage independence</li>
<li>identifies and uses strategies which affirm individuality</li>
<li>uses strategies which involve the family/significant others in care</li>
<li>identifies and recommends appropriate support networks to individuals/groups</li>
<li>identifies situations which may threaten the dignity/ integrity of an individual/group</li>
<li>implements measures to maintain dignity of individuals/groups during periods of self-care deficit</li>
<li>implements measures to support individuals/ groups experiencing emotional distress</li>
<li>information is provided to individuals/groups to enhance their control over their own health care</li>
</ul>
<p>9.4 Assists and supports individuals/groups to make informed health care decisions</p>
<ul>
<li>facilitates and encourages individual/group decision-making</li>
<li>maintains and supports respect for an individual/ group's decision through communication with other members of the interdisciplinary health care team</li>
<li>arranges consultation to support individuals/ groups to make informed decisions regarding health care</li>
</ul>
<p>9.5 Facilitates a physical, psychosocial, cultural and spiritual environment that promotes individual/group safety and security</p>
<ul>
<li>demonstrates sensitivity, awareness and respect for cultural identity as part of an individual's/ group's perceptions of security</li>
<li>demonstrates sensitivity, awareness and respect in regard to an individual's/group's spiritual needs</li>
<li>involves family and others in ensuring that cultural and spiritual needs are met</li>
<li>identifies, eliminates or prevents environmental hazards where possible</li>
<li>applies relevant principles to ensure the safe administration of therapeutic substances</li>
<li>maintains standards for infection control</li>
<li>applies ergonomic principles to prevent injury to individual/group and self</li>
<li>prioritises safety problems</li>
<li>adheres to occupational health and safety legislation</li>
<li>modifies environmental factors to meet an individual's/group's comfort needs where possible</li>
<li>promotes individual/group comfort throughout interventions</li>
<li>uses ergonomic principles and appropriate aids to promote the individual/group's comfort</li>
</ul>
<p>NATIONAL COMPETENCIES FOR THE REGISTERED NURSEâ€”AUSTRALIA
321</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="national-competency-standards-for-the-registered-nurse-continued">National Competency Standards for the Registered Nurse (continued)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#national-competency-standards-for-the-registered-nurse-continued" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="10-collaborates-with-the-interdisciplinary-health-care-team-to-provide-comprehensive-nursing-care">10. Collaborates with the interdisciplinary health care team to provide comprehensive nursing care<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#10-collaborates-with-the-interdisciplinary-health-care-team-to-provide-comprehensive-nursing-care" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="10-1-recognises-that-the-membership-and-roles-of-health-care-teams-and-service-providers-will-vary-depending-on-an-individual-s-group-s-needs-and-health-care-setting">10.1 Recognises that the membership and roles of health care teams and service providers will vary depending on an individual's/group's needs and health care setting<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#10-1-recognises-that-the-membership-and-roles-of-health-care-teams-and-service-providers-will-vary-depending-on-an-individual-s-group-s-needs-and-health-care-setting" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>recognises the impact and role of population, primary health and partnership health care models</li>
<li>recognises when to negotiate with, or refer to, other health care or service providers</li>
<li>establishes positive and productive working relationships with colleagues</li>
<li>recognises and understands the separate and interdependent roles and functions of health care team members</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="10-2-communicates-nursing-assessments-and-decisions-to-the-interdisciplinary-health-care-team-and-other-relevant-service-providers">10.2 Communicates nursing assessments and decisions to the interdisciplinary health care team and other relevant service providers<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#10-2-communicates-nursing-assessments-and-decisions-to-the-interdisciplinary-health-care-team-and-other-relevant-service-providers" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>explains the nursing role to the interdisciplinary team and service providers</li>
<li>maintains confidentiality in discussions about an individual/group's needs and progress</li>
<li>discusses individual/group care requirements with relevant members of the health care team</li>
<li>collaborates with members of the health care team in decision making about care of individuals/groups</li>
<li>demonstrates skills in written, verbal and electronic communication</li>
<li>documents, as soon possible, forms of communication, nursing interventions and individual/group responses</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="10-3-facilitates-coordination-of-care-to-achieve-agreed-health-outcomes">10.3 Facilitates coordination of care to achieve agreed health outcomes<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#10-3-facilitates-coordination-of-care-to-achieve-agreed-health-outcomes" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>adopts and implements a collaborative approach to practice</li>
<li>participates in health care team activities</li>
<li>demonstrates the necessary communication skills to manage avoidance, confusion and confrontation</li>
<li>demonstrates the necessary communication skills to enable negotiation</li>
<li>demonstrates an understanding of how collaboration has an impact on the safe and effective provision of comprehensive care</li>
<li>establishes and maintains effective and collaborative working relationships with other members of the health care team</li>
<li>consults with relevant health care professionals and service providers to facilitate continuity of care</li>
<li>recognises the contribution of, and liaises with, relevant community and support services</li>
<li>records information systematically in an accessible and retrievable form</li>
<li>ensures that written communication is comprehensive, logical, legible, clear and concise, spelling is accurate and only acceptable abbreviations are used</li>
<li>establishes and maintains documentation according to organisational guidelines and procedures</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="10-4-collaborates-with-the-health-care-team-to-inform-policy-and-guideline-development">10.4 Collaborates with the health care team to inform policy and guideline development<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#10-4-collaborates-with-the-health-care-team-to-inform-policy-and-guideline-development" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>regularly consults policies and guidelines</li>
<li>demonstrates awareness of changes to policies and guidelines</li>
<li>attends meetings and participates in practice reviews and audits</li>
<li>demonstrates understanding of the implications of national health strategies for nursing and health care practice</li>
</ul>
<p>322 FUNDAMENTALS OF NURSING: CLINICAL SKILLS WORKBOOK</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="glossary">Glossary<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#glossary" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>ANMC: Australian Nursing and Midwifery Council</p>
<p>Appropriate: Matching the circumstances, meeting needs of the individual, groups or situation</p>
<p>Attributes: Characteristics which underpin competent performance</p>
<p>Core Competency Standards: Essential competency standards for Standards registration or licensure.</p>
<p>Competence: The combination of skills, knowledge, attitudes, values and abilities that underpin effective and/or superior performance in a profession/occupational area.</p>
<p>Competent: The person has competence across all the domains of competencies applicable to the nurse, at a standard that is judged to be appropriate for the level of nurse being assessed.</p>
<p>Competency Unit: Represents a major function/functional area in the total competencies of a Registered Nurse in a nursing context representing a stand-alone function which can be performed by the individual.</p>
<p>Competency Element: Represents a sub-function of the competency unit.</p>
<p>Competency Standards: Consists of competency units and competency elements.</p>
<p>The Registered Nurse Competency Standards 2006 document is now property of the Nursing and Midwifery Board of Australia (National Board). The best source of further updates and current information on nursing and midwifery codes, guidelines, position statements, FAQs and Fact Sheets is the National Board website <a href="http://www.nursingmidwiferyboard.gov.au" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">www.nursingmidwiferyboard.gov.au</a>.</p>
<p>Contexts: The setting/environment where competence can be demonstrated or applied.</p>
<p>Cues: Key generic examples of competent performance. They are neither comprehensive nor exhaustive. They assist the assessor when using their professional judgement in assessing nursing practice. They further assist curriculum development.</p>
<p>Domain: An organised cluster of competencies in nursing practice.</p>
<p>Enrolled Nurse: A person licensed under an Australian State or Territory Nurses Act or Health Professionals Act to provide nursing care under the supervision of a Registered Nurse. Referred to as a Registered Nurse Division II in Victoria.</p>
<p>Exemplars: Concrete, key examples chosen to be typical of competence. They are not the standard but are indicative of the standard.</p>
<p>Registered Nurse: A person licensed to practice nursing under an Australian State or Territory Nurses Act or Health Professionals Act. Referred to as a Registered Nurse Division 1 in Victoria.</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="9ec0e97f">National Competencies for the Registered Nurseâ€”New Zealand<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#9ec0e97f" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
